availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Marshall Alexander (Fulton County, Kentucky, physician and Confederate surgeon)

body.p: Fulton County, Kentucky, physician and Confederate surgeon.Tennessee native. Married to Mary F. Alexander. Father of H. C. Alexander, Thomas J. Alexander, Susan A. Alexander, Elizabeth Alexander, Emma B. Alexander, James Alexander and Marshall Alexander. Physician in Fulton County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Fulton County in 1860. Confederate surgeon captured after the Battle of Perryville. Prisoner of War in October 1862.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 40. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 6. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, District No. 2, p. 14. United States. The War of the Rebellion: A Compilation of the Official Records of the Union and Confederate Armies Series II, Vol. 5 (Washington: G.P.O., 1880) 16.
